metadata.title: Centimeters to Inches Converter (cm to in) - NIST Standard
metadata.description: Convert centimeters to inches with scientific precision using the exact 2.54 cm/inch factor. Ideal for engineering, health, and everyday measurements.

introduction: This centimeters to inches converter provides precise translations based on the official international standard, making it a reliable tool for scientific, engineering, and everyday applications.
By using the exact relationship of 1 inch = 2.54 centimeters, this tool ensures your measurements are accurate for everything from technical specifications to personal health tracking.
We provide the formula, worked examples, and authoritative context to help you convert cm to inches with confidence and avoid common rounding errors.
methodology: The conversion from centimeters to inches is performed by dividing the centimeter value by 2.54.
This factor is exact, based on the 1959 International Yard and Pound Agreement, which defined the international inch as precisely 2.54 centimeters.
This standard is used by metrology institutions worldwide, including the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST), ensuring universal consistency for all measurements.
examples: Health & Fitness: A person with a waist circumference of 80 cm converts to approximately 31.5 inches, a common metric for health assessments.
Electronics: A 68 cm computer monitor is equivalent to a 27-inch screen, helping users compare metric and imperial product specifications.
Manufacturing: A component specified as 5.08 cm in a technical drawing is exactly 2.00 inches, ensuring parts fit with zero conversion error.

faqs.question: What is the exact formula for converting centimeters to inches?
faqs.answer: The official formula is: inches = centimeters / 2.54. Because the definition is exact, there is no rounding involved in the conversion factor itself.

faqs.question: How many centimeters are in one inch?
faqs.answer: There are exactly 2.54 centimeters in one international inch. This was established by treaty in 1959 to standardize measurements between metric and imperial systems.

faqs.question: Is there a simpler way to estimate the conversion?
faqs.answer: For a quick mental estimate, you can approximate the conversion by multiplying the centimeters by 0.4. For example, 10 cm is roughly 4 inches. However, for accurate results, always use the exact 2.54 division.

faqs.question: Why is this conversion important for international standards?
faqs.answer: Having an exact, agreed-upon definition is critical for international trade, science, and engineering. It ensures that a part designed in a metric country will fit perfectly in a system specified in inches in another country.

citations.label: NIST Special Publication 1038: The International System of Units (SI) Conversion Factors for General Use
citations.summary: Provides the official U.S. government guidance on SI conversion factors, listing the inch as exactly 2.54 centimeters.

citations.label: Federal Register (Vol. 24, No. 128): Refinement of Values for the Yard and the Pound
citations.summary: The original 1959 notice that officially defined the international yard in terms of the meter, which in turn fixes the inch at 2.54 cm.
